value.name: Pierre Poilievre defends Alberta Premier Smith on transgender policies
value.description: Conservative Leader Pierre Poilievre defended Alberta Premier Danielle Smith and her approach to transgender issues Tuesday, saying the Liberal government and the media have demonized her for policies that would give parents more say over their kids.

value.name: Europe farmers protests: EU scraps plans to halve pesticide use
value.description: The head of the European Commission, Ursula von der Leyen, has announced plans to scrap a proposal halving pesticide use across the EU. The move is an apparent concession to farmers who have been protesting in many EU countries against regulations including the planned reduction in pesticide use.

value.name: Bury North MP James Daly appointed deputy chair of Conservative Party
value.description: Bury North MP James Daly has been appointed to a key position in Conservative Party. Mr Daly has been made deputy chair of the party, following in the footsteps of MPs Lee Anderson and Brendan Clarke-Smith, who resigned as joint-deputy chairmen over the Rwanda vote last month.

value.name: US Senate deal on border security and Ukraine aid facing defeat
value.description: The Democratic president has urged lawmakers to embrace a bipartisan Senate deal that pairs border enforcement measures with 60 billion dollars (£48 billion) in wartime aid for Ukraine, as well as tens of billions of dollars more for Israel, other US allies in Asia, the US immigration system and humanitarian aid for civilians in Gaza and Ukraine.

about.name: Security on the Mass Rapid Transit

value.name: Tories losing next week's by-election will be 'tipping point' for 'seismic' election defeat, Nadine Dorries tells LBC
value.description: The Tories losing next week's by-election in Wellingborough will act as a 'tipping point' before the party faces a 'seismic' electoral wipeout, Nadine Dorries has told LBC.

value.name: How I wish I’d grown up in a time without the internet
value.description: Generation X, the cohort born roughly between 1965 and 1980, stands as the final generation to truly comprehend life without the incessant presence of a smartphone or computer screen. In today’s MetroTalk, a Gen-Z (1997 – 2012) reader expresses nostalgia for an era untouched by the pervasive influence of internet-induced ‘brain rot.’

value.name: Truss warns of ‘left-wing extremists’ as she seeks to galvanise ‘secret Tories’
value.description: Liz Truss has hit out at Rishi Sunak for failing to take on “left-wing extremists” she said had gained control of UK institutions.

value.name: Senate deal on border security and Ukraine aid faces defeat as Republicans ready to block bill
value.description: A bipartisan Senate deal intended to curb illegal crossings at the U.S. border with Mexico faced almost certain defeat Tuesday as Senate Republicans signaled their opposition, stranding President Joe Biden with no clear way to advance aid for Ukraine through Congress.

value.name: Truss summons ‘Secret Tories’ to fight Davos and Left
value.description: SECRET Tories were summoned to the fight against “Davos man” and the global left at today’s launch of the Popular Conservatives movement. The new group is fronted by ex-premier Liz Truss, who used her speech to rail against “wokery,” obstructive institutions, left-wing “extremists” and environmentalists.
